name: Taskabun
description:
Taskabun

Taskabun is a multiplayer game Developed in the Godot engine with GDScript using the NetwoengineultiplayerEnet library.

You can connect between desktop devices, mobile devices, or a mix of both!

This game is only currently available on LAN means that all the devices must be connected to the same internet.

At the moment the game can only be played on Windows and Android devices.

Features
  • Can be played in singleplayer mode.

  • Can be played in multiplayer with up to 4 players.

  • 4 Unique characters to choose to play as.

  • A Park board that consists of 100 tiles and a quick board that consists of 21 tiles.

  • 7 unique snake enemies.

  • 2 mini tasks.
How to play Connecting
  1. You need an Internet connection first, without it you won't be able to play it.

  2. There is going to be a popup where the game will ask permission to connect to the internet so please allow it.

  3. You host a game by creating a server, the IP address of the host will be shown down below the character: This is the way to let the players join you locally.

  4. You can play this game as a single player but you need to host a game.

  5. You join other players by pressing the join button, but if it doesn't appear you can manually enter the IP address of the host here:

    You must enter it correctly or else it won't work

The Board
  1. It's a simple snakes and ladders game where you throw the dice and move forward, but there is more to it.

  2. If you land on a symbol of a lighting bulb that's called a task, a task is a mini-game if you beat it you will gain an extra move just like ladders, but if you lose you won't gain the extra move.

  3. If you land on a snake there will be two options for you, either forfeit which means that you don't want to find the snake and you accept the fact that you will go backward, or fight which will lead you to fight the snake to keep your place.

  4. If you have reached the last tile you will be given two options, either fight a boss snake or solve a hard task, win either of these and you will be crowned as a winner.
Keyboard
  1. Movement: AWSD (physical) or the arrow keys
  2. Attack: k (physical)
Credits
  • BGM/SFX: Zapsplat.com
Some notes
  • They are still work-in-progress animations.
  • Two maps aren't available (River and Mountain)
  • There are no settings
